caption.paragraph:
TABLE 5. A selection of characters for
Proceraea
­taxa. Colour refers to live specimens. Abbreviations as occurring under each headline. Length of the proventricle is noted in brackets and measured as the number of body segments it covers. Nuchal epaulettes: b=beginning, m=middle, e=end, ts=tentacular segment, 1=chaetiger 1. Ets equals extension of nuchal epaulettes to end of tentacular segment. Trepan teeth, teeth arrangement: L=large, S=small. Terminal tooth of compound chaetae in anterior chaetigers (Ttcc­ac), terminal tooth of compound chaetae in median and posterior chaetigers(ttcc­mpc): s=small terminal tooth, l=large terminal tooth. Distribution: N=North, C=Central, S=South, W=West, E=East, A=Atlantic, P=Pacific, IO=Indian Ocean.

tr.td: red and black spots on dorsum,
brown/black transverse bands, medially nar­ rowed
7 black spots per segment, ven­ trally one black longitudinal band
2 distinct and two more or less dis­ tinct longitudinal black bands
2 black longitudi­ nal lines, brown pigmentation in squares
2 longitudinal black lines, trans­ verse brown and orange bands

tableNote.paragraph: A Additional features: thin bayonet chaetae, subdistally denticulated. B Additional features: large trepan teeth.

C Additional features: well­developed ciliated ridge on palps. D Additional features: unidentate compounds in anterior chaetigers. a Reference:
Ben­Eliahu 1977
.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 6 . A selection of characters for
Virchowia
­taxa. Abbreviations as occurring under each headline. Length of the proventricle is noted in brackets and measured as the number of body segments it covers. Trepan teeth: L=large, S=small. Reproductive mode: S=schizogamy, AS=anterior scissiparity. Distribution: N=North, S=South, W=West, E=East, A=Atlantic, P=Pacific, IO=Indian Ocean, ANT=Antarctic.

TABLE 7. A selection of characters for Procerini­taxa excluding
Proceraea
. Abbreviations as occuring under each headline. Length of the proventricle is noted in brackets and measured as the number of body segments it covers. Nuchal epaulettes: b=beginning, m=median, e=end, ts=tentacular segment, 1=chaetiger 1. Ets equals extension of nuchal epaulettes to the end of tentacular segment. Trepan teeth: L=large, S=small. Reproductive mode: S=schizogamy, AS=anterior scissiparity. Distribution: N=North, C=Central, S=South, W=West, E=East, A=Atlantic, P=Pacific, IO=Indian Ocean, ANT=Antarctic.

tr.th: Proven­ Rows of tricle in muscle chaeti­ cells ger

tableNote.paragraph: A Additional features: bidentate simple chaetae in chaetiger 1–4 B Additional features: uni­ and bidentate simple chaetae in chaetiger 1–4 C Additional features: only unidentate simple chaetae in all chaetigers D Additional features: compounds and simple chaetae in all chaetigers E.

Additional features: flattened, lanceolate cirri F Additional features: brown spots at base of dorsal cirri. G Additional features: fusiform anterior appendages, only simple chaetae. a Reference:
Gidholm 1967
.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 8A. A selection of characters for
Myrianida
­taxa. Colour refers to live specimens. Abbreviations as occuring under each headline. Length of the proventricle is noted in brackets and measured as the number of body segments it covers. Nuchal epaulettes: b=beginning, m=middle, e=end, ts=tentacular segment, 1=chaetiger 1. Ets equals extension of nuchal epaulettes to the end of tentacular segment. Trepan teeth, teeth arrangement: L=large, S=small. Basal ring, infradental spines: y=present, n=absent.

caption.paragraph: TABLE 8B. Abbreviations as occuring under each headline. Length of the proventricle is noted in brackets and measured as the number of body segments it covers. Cirrophores alternation, cirrophores c.f. parapodial lobes, cirrostyles alternation: eq=equal, uneq=unequal. Reproductive mode: S=schizogamy, G=gemmiparity, P=posterior scissiparity. Additional features : ldt=large distal tooth in compound chaetae. Distribution: N=North, C=Central, S=South, W=West, E=East, A=Atlantic, P=Pacific, I=Indian Ocean, M=Mediterranean.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 9. A selection of characters for
Epigamia
­taxa. Colour refers to live specimens. Abbreviations as occuring under each headline. Length of the proventricle is noted in brackets and measured as the number of body segments it covers. Nuchal epaulettes: b=beginning, m=middle, e=end, 1=chaetiger 1. B1 equals extension of nuchal epaulettes to end of chaetiger 1. Trepan teeth, teeth arrangement: L=large teeth, S=small teeth, /=alternating. Distal tooth in compound chaetae: s=small distal tooth, l=large distal tooth. Distribution: N=North, C=Central, W=West, E=East, A=Atlantic, P=Pacific, M=Mediterranean Sea, ANT=Antarctic.

tr.td: faint red­ dish­ yel­ low, red
orange with bright yellow mid­ line

A Additional features: two small spines at base of large teeth B Additional features: cirri from chaetiger 3 flattened C Additional features: very large parapodial lobes a Reference:
San Martín 1994
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Linnean name definition . Type genus
Proceraea
Ehlers, 1864
.

Node­based name definition .
Procerini
refers to the least inclusive clade comprising
Imajimaea zonata (
Mohammad, 1973
)
,
Imajimaea draculai
(
San Martín & López, 2002
),
Virchowia
[
Langerhans, 1879
] Nygren, 200 X,
Levidorum
[
Hartman, 1967
] Nygren, 200 X, and
Proceraea
[
Ehlers, 1864
] Nygren, 200 X.
